content: good for fastest or shortest, but a bit hard for reverse

Got this one in reversed, noone got it.
It is a little too hard for reversed so please remove it from the reversed category :P

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Issues have been fixed :)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: good puzzle - think this will be pretty hard for reverse mode, but doable.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Cool idea for a Clash of Code :)
Meanwhile, your solution is very elegant.
Well, good idea but tests 2, 3 and 4 are too much complicated to understand quickly the algorithm. Numbers are not enough differencing themselves to be able to understand what's your aim.

This looks like the start of a decent CoC. A couple of things though:

- In Validator 1, "1" and "512" have the same number of 1's in their binary representation. Same with Test 2, "-3" and "-5".
- I would not include negative numbers since it doesn't add anything to the puzzle. Also, there is a slight ambiguity about whether to include the 1 that represents the negative in signed integers.
- Copy/move "All given integers..." to the constraints section.
- If you want to include this in reverse mode, you should definitely have the first or second test sort "63 31 15 7 3 1 0" or maybe "64 96 112 120 124 126 127". Otherwise, I think it would be too much to guess what it is.
You're definitely right about all that, thank you for your detailled and fruitful comment, I'll make sure to make the modifications in the next days.
That's kinda what I wanted to do; the first two tests let you understand what is expected and the rest is for validating your solution works for more complex inputs.
